      • getAllCombinations

        public static java.util.Set<Assignment> getAllCombinations(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<Value>> valuesMatrix)
        Generates all possible assignment combinations from the set of values provided as parameters -- each variable being associated with a set of alternative values.

        NB: use with caution, computational complexity is exponential!

        Parameters:
        valuesMatrix - the set of values to combine
        Returns:
        the list of all possible combinations

      • getNBest

        public static <T> java.util.LinkedHashMap<T,java.lang.Double> getNBest(java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Double> initTable,
                                                                       int nbest)
        Returns a smaller version of the initial table that only retains the N elements with a highest value
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements in the table
        Parameters:
        initTable - the full initial table
        nbest - the number of elements to retain
        Returns:
        the resulting subset of the table

      • getRanking

        public static <T> int getRanking(java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Double> initTable,
                                 T assign,
                                 double minDifference)
        Returns the ranking of the given assignment in the table, assuming an ordering of the table in descending order.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements in the table
        Parameters:
        initTable - the table
        assign - the assignment to find
        minDifference - the minimum difference between values
        Returns:
        the index in the ordered table, or -1 if the element is not in the table
